content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` that does the required task:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    doc = parse(Markdown.Document, md)
    code_blocks = []

    for block in doc.blocks
        if block isa Markdown.CodeBlock
            language = get(block.meta, "language", "")
            if lowercase(language) == "julia"
                push!(code_blocks, block.content)
            end
        end
    end

    return join(code_blocks, "\n\n")
end
```

This function uses the Markdown.jl library to parse the provided markdown string. It then iterates through all the blocks in the parsed document, checks if the block is a code block, and if the language is Julia, it pushes the content of the code block to an array. Finally, it joins all the code blocks together with a double newline character and returns the result as a string.
